content:
#15743 is the first in a short series of PRs introducing Jacobi sums and their basic properties. The further development can be seen in this github repo.

The material on Jacobi sums of cubic characters (this is still a few PRs away) is a prerequisite for formalizing a proof of cubic reciprocity (which has been done by a student of mine in his BSc thesis; I'm planning to get that into Mathlib eventually).

The next one is #16227 . It adds results on Jacobi sums of the forms J(1, χ), J(χ, χ⁻¹), and J(χ, ψ) for χψ nontrivial. (The last one needs Gauss sums, which increases the (transitive) imports quite a bit.)
bors is failing on #16227 because of style linter errors in CategoryTheory/Adjunction/... Should I try to do something to fix that? And if so, what?
(#16646 seems to have the same problem...)
Normally, the issue should already have been fixed, by #16677 which got just merged.
So, you don't have anything to do.
This is not the first time that it happens in the last few days: it looks like some linters are not doing their job...
#16734 is the next one. It adds two results for the case when the characters go from a finite field into another field.
Slowly continuing with #17003 (still on vacation...). Two more results on the value of a Jacobi sum.
Is there more to be done for #17003 (other than fixing the typo in the PR title - thanks!)?
#17336 adds a formula for the nth power of the Gauss sum of a multiplicative character om a finite field in terms of a product of Jacobi sums, where n is the order of the character.
